task.title: Applying transformation to data
task.shortdesc: You can transform your data by renaming fields, joining time series data, and performing mathematical operations across queries.

ul.li: Added a RMF data source in Grafana. See .
Created a dashboard in Grafana. See .

taskbody.context:
You can add multiple transformation to your data. When there are multiple transformations, Grafana applies them sequentially. Each transformation produces a result set that is passed on to the next transformation in the pipeline.
Grafana provides several ways that you can transform data. For entire list of transformations, refer to the Grafana documentation.

step.cmd: Identify the dashboard for which you want to add the transformation.
Move the mouse pointer over any part of the panel to display the Menu icon.
Click the Menu icon, and then select Edit.
Click the Transformation tab, and then select a transformation from the list.
step.info: Upon accessing the transformation options, a dedicated row is presented for configuration.You can click + Add Transformation to add multiple transformations to data.

step.cmd: Click Save to store the changes made to the dashboard.

taskbody.result: You have added the transformation to the data.
